name: Acadia National Park
description: Acadia National Park protects the natural beauty of the highest rocky headlands along the Atlantic coastline of the United States.

name: Arches National Park
description: Famous for preserving over 2,000 natural sandstone arches, including the world-famous Delicate Arch.

name: Badlands National Park
description: Badlands National Park protects 244,000 acres of sharply eroded buttes, pinnacles and spires.

name: Big Bend National Park
description: Big Bend National Park encompasses the Rio Grande's big bend and includes desert, mountains and river environments.

name: Biscayne National Park
description: Biscayne National Park encompasses coral reefs, islands and shoreline mangrove forest in the northern Florida Keys.

name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
description: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park preserves a spectacular gorge with dark, steep walls.

name: Bryce Canyon National Park
description: Famous for its crimson-colored hoodoos, which are spire-shaped rock formations.

name: Canyonlands National Park
description: Canyonlands National Park preserves a colorful landscape eroded into countless canyons, mesas and buttes.

name: Capitol Reef National Park
description: Capitol Reef National Park is centered on the Waterpocket Fold, a 100-mile long wrinkle in the earth.

name: Carlsbad Caverns National Park
description: Carlsbad Caverns National Park features more than 119 known caves formed in a fossil reef.

name: Channel Islands National Park
description: Channel Islands National Park encompasses five remarkable islands and their ocean environment.

name: Congaree National Park
description: Congaree National Park preserves the largest intact expanse of old growth bottomland hardwood forest.

name: Crater Lake National Park
description: Crater Lake National Park is famous for its deep blue lake formed in a volcanic caldera.

name: Cuyahoga Valley National Park
description: Cuyahoga Valley National Park preserves and reclaims the rural landscape along the Cuyahoga River.

name: Death Valley National Park
description: Death Valley National Park is the hottest, driest and lowest national park in the United States.

name: Denali National Park
description: Denali National Park is home to North America's tallest mountain, Denali (formerly Mount McKinley).

name: Dry Tortugas National Park
description: Dry Tortugas National Park is known for bird watching, snorkeling, and Fort Jefferson.

name: Everglades National Park
description: Everglades National Park protects an unparalleled landscape that provides important habitat for numerous rare species.

name: Gates of the Arctic National Park
description: Gates of the Arctic National Park is the northernmost national park in the United States.

name: Glacier National Park
description: Glacier National Park showcases over 1 million acres of pristine forest, alpine meadows, rugged mountains and pristine lakes.

name: Glacier Bay National Park
description: Glacier Bay National Park preserves a spectacular coastline of tidewater glaciers, snow-capped mountain ranges, and temperate rainforest.

name: Grand Canyon National Park
description: Grand Canyon National Park is a World Heritage Site known for its layered bands of colorful rock revealing millions of years of geological history.

name: Grand Teton National Park
description: Grand Teton National Park includes the major peaks of the 40-mile-long Teton Range as well as most of the northern sections of the valley known as Jackson Hole.

name: Great Basin National Park
description: Great Basin National Park is located in Nevada's Snake Range and includes Wheeler Peak, the second highest mountain in Nevada.

name: Great Sand Dunes National Park
description: Great Sand Dunes National Park preserves North America's tallest sand dunes.

name: Great Smoky Mountains National Park
description: Great Smoky Mountains National Park straddles the ridgeline of the Great Smoky Mountains, part of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

name: Guadalupe Mountains National Park
description: Guadalupe Mountains National Park contains Guadalupe Peak, the highest point in Texas.

name: Haleakalā National Park
description: Haleakalā National Park protects unique and fragile ecosystems and preserves the culture and history of Native Hawaiians.

name: Hawaiʻi Volcanoes National Park
description: Hawaiʻi Volcanoes National Park encompasses two active volcanoes: Kīlauea, one of the world's most active volcanic masses, and Mauna Loa.

name: Hot Springs National Park
description: Hot Springs National Park is centered on natural hot springs that flow out of the Ouachita Mountains.

name: Indiana Dunes National Park
description: Indiana Dunes National Park consists of 15 miles of the southern shore of Lake Michigan.

name: Isle Royale National Park
description: Isle Royale National Park consists of a roadless island archipelago in Lake Superior.

name: Joshua Tree National Park
description: Joshua Tree National Park is characterized by rugged rock formations and stark desert landscapes.

name: Katmai National Park
description: Katmai National Park is famous for brown bears fishing for salmon at Brooks Falls.

name: Kenai Fjords National Park
description: Kenai Fjords National Park lies at the edge of the Kenai Peninsula close to the town of Seward.

name: Kings Canyon National Park
description: Kings Canyon National Park features some of the largest trees on Earth in its groves of giant sequoias.

name: Kobuk Valley National Park
description: Kobuk Valley National Park preserves the 25-square-mile Great Kobuk Sand Dunes and surrounding area.

name: Lake Clark National Park
description: Lake Clark National Park includes many lakes and rivers critical to fish spawning.

name: Lassen Volcanic National Park
description: Lassen Volcanic National Park is home to steaming fumaroles, meadows freckled with wildflowers, and clear mountain lakes.

name: Mammoth Cave National Park
description: Mammoth Cave National Park preserves the cave system and a part of the Green River valley.

name: Mesa Verde National Park
description: Mesa Verde National Park preserves a spectacular collection of archaeological sites of the Ancestral Puebloan culture.

name: Mount Rainier National Park
description: Mount Rainier National Park encompasses Mount Rainier, a 14,411-foot stratovolcano.

name: New River Gorge National Park
description: New River Gorge National Park preserves 53 miles of the New River Gorge, one of the oldest rivers on the continent.

name: North Cascades National Park
description: North Cascades National Park consists of a northern and southern section, bisected by the Skagit River.

name: Olympic National Park
description: Olympic National Park encompasses several distinct ecosystems, from glacier-capped mountains to old-growth temperate rain forests.

name: Petrified Forest National Park
description: Petrified Forest National Park is known for its fossils, especially fallen trees that lived in the Late Triassic Epoch.

name: Pinnacles National Park
description: Pinnacles National Park protects a mountainous area located east of the Salinas Valley.

name: Redwood National and State Parks
description: Redwood National and State Parks protect 45% of all remaining coast redwood old-growth forests.

name: Rocky Mountain National Park
description: Rocky Mountain National Park encompasses the heart of the northern Front Range of the Rocky Mountains.

name: Saguaro National Park
description: Saguaro National Park protects part of the Sonoran Desert, including the saguaro cactus.

name: Sequoia National Park
description: Sequoia National Park is home to giant sequoia trees, including the General Sherman Tree.

name: Shenandoah National Park
description: Shenandoah National Park encompasses part of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Virginia.

name: Theodore Roosevelt National Park
description: Theodore Roosevelt National Park consists of three geographically separated areas of badlands.

name: Virgin Islands National Park
description: Virgin Islands National Park preserves about 60% of the land area of Saint John island.

name: Voyageurs National Park
description: Voyageurs National Park lies adjacent to the Canada–United States border and consists of four large lakes.

name: White Sands National Park
description: White Sands National Park preserves a major portion of the world's largest gypsum dunefield.

name: Wind Cave National Park
description: Wind Cave National Park is notable for its cave, one of the longest and most complex caves in the world.

name: Wrangell-St. Elias National Park
description: Wrangell-St. Elias National Park is the largest national park in the United States.

name: Yellowstone National Park
description: Yellowstone National Park was the first national park in the world and is known for its geothermal features.

name: Yosemite National Park
description: Yosemite National Park is internationally recognized for its granite cliffs, waterfalls, clear streams, giant sequoia groves, and biological diversity.

name: Zion National Park
description: Zion National Park is located in southwestern Utah near the town of Springdale.
